summary: ABOUT THE JOURNAL CMJ is an international, peer-reviewed, open-access publication. the journal allows free access (Open Access) to its contents and permits authors to self-archive final accepted version of the articles on any OAI-compliant institutional / subject-based repository. the journal will cover basic and clinical studies in field of all medicine, especially general medicine. each manuscript is assigned to a member of the editorial team. the author is requested to provide a point by point response to reviewers’ comments and submit a revised version of the manuscript. submission of the manuscript to final decision is completed online. authorship credit should be based only on substantial contributions to each of the four components mentioned above. participation solely in the acquisition of funding or the collection of data does not justify authorship. authorship credit should be based on substantial contributions to each of the four components mentioned above. manuscripts that are not as per the “Instructions for Authors” would be returned to the authors for technical correction before they undergo editorial/ peer-review. title of the manuscript, names of all authors/ contributorsand name(s) of department(s) and/or institution(s) to which the work should be credited. a statement of financial or other relationships that might lead to a conflict of interest, if that information is not included in the manuscript itself or in an authors’ form. a statement that the manuscript has been read and approved by all the authors. each author believes that the manuscript represents honest work, if that information is not provided in another form. the copyright transfer form must be submitted in original with the signatures of all contributors within two weeks of submission via courier or email. high resolution images (up to 5 MB each) can be sent by email. a statement of financial or other relationships that might lead to a conflict of interest, if that information is not included in the manuscript itself or in an authors’ form. the main text of the article, beginning from Abstract till References (including tables) should be in this file. the main text of the article, beginning from Abstract till References (including tables) should be in this file. contributors’/copyright transfer form The copyright transfer form must be submitted in original with the signatures of all the contributors within two weeks of submission via courier or email as a scanned image. high resolution images (up to 5 MB each) can be sent by email. Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, References, Tables and Figure legends. Abstract The abstract of original articles in CMJ is a structured abstract. the total number words of abstract is no more than 300 words. a statement on ethics committee permission and ethical practices must be included in all research articles under the ‘Methods’ section. Identify the methods, apparatus (give the manufacturer's name and address in parentheses) and procedures in sufficient detail to allow other workers to reproduce the results. authors should report losses to observation. avoid non-technical uses of technical terms in statistics. 'random', 'normal','significant', 'correlations', and'sample' meta analysis Only results of meta analysis are reported in this kind of article. the length of the article is within 2000-3500 words (not including tables, figures, and references) the manuscript should have an abstract (250 words) representing an accurate summary of the article. clinical practice Authors of these articles provide their experience for diagnosis, treatment or prevention of diseases. new, interesting and rare cases can be reported. cases with clinical significance or implications will be given priority. the titles of journals should be abbreviated according to the style used in Index Medicus. avoid using abstracts as references unless it provides essential information not available from a public source. s369-s378: Payne DK, Sullivan MD, Massie MJ. Women's psychological reactions to breast cancer. a book citation Weinstein L, Swartz MN. Arthroscopic ankle arthrodesis. table with their legends should be provided at the end of the text. the file size should be within 4MB in size while uploading Figures should be numbered consecutively according to the order in which they have been cited. image has minimum resolution of 300 dpi or 1800 1600 pixels in TIFF format. each figure should have a label pasted (avoid use of liquid gum for pasting) on its back indicating the number of the figure, the running title, top of the figure and the legends of the figure. the ethical standards of experiments must be in accordance with guidelines provided by the Committee for the Purpose of Control and Supervision of Experiments on Animals (CPCSEA) and World Medical Association Declaration of Helsinki on Ethical Principles for Medical Research Involving Humans. the journal will not consider any paper which is ethically unacceptable. results Present your results in a logical sequence in the text, tables, and illustrations, giving the main or most important findings first. avoid non-technical uses of technical terms in statistics, such as ‘random’ (which implies a randomizing device), ‘normal’, ‘significant’, ‘correlations’, and ‘sample’. the meta analysis should have a heading: Keywords, Abstract, Introduction, Methods, Results, Discussion, Reference, Tables and Legends. the length of the article is within 2000-3500 words (not including tables, figures, and references) the prescribed word count is up to 3500 words excluding tables, references and abstract. the manuscript may have about 90 references. the manuscript should have an abstract (250 words) representing an accurate summary of the article. editorials can be up to 2000 words length with no more than 25 references. references should be numbered consecutively in order in which they are first mentioned in the text (not in alphabetic order) if more than 6, list the first 6 authors followed by et al. examples of citations Wang YS, Miao LY, Liu L, Cai HR, Ding JJ, Ren SX, et al. tables should be self-explanatory and should not duplicate textual material. tables should be self-explanatory and should not duplicate textual material. a credit line should appear in the legend for such figures. type or print out legends for illustrations using double spacing. a credit line should appear in the legend for such figures. revised version of the manuscript should be submitted online in a manner similar to that used for submission of the manuscript for the first time. contributors are requested to include the'referees' remarks along with point to point clarification at the beginning in the revised file itself. key words provided should be after punctuation marks References according to the journal's instructions, punctuation marks checked Send the article file without ‘Track Changes’ if a brand name is cited, supply the manufacturer's name and address (city and country) key words provided (three or no more than 6 words)introduction should be short and arresting. write the full term for each abbreviation at its first use in the title, abstract, keywords and text separately unless it is a standard unit of measure.
